info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 8 at 1:07PM PDT until October 11 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following areas, Lake Havasu and Fort Mohave, Lake Mead National Recreation Area, Northwest Deserts and Northwest Plateau.
* WHEN...From Thursday morning through Saturday evening.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moisture from Hurricane Priscilla will move into the area, helping to fuel multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms from Thursday through Saturday. Due to the tropical nature of this moisture, storms are expected to be efficient rainfall producers with rain rates in excess of 1 inch per hour expected with stronger storms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Northwest Plateau; Lake Havasu and Fort Mohave; Northwest Deserts; Lake Mead National Recreation Area
